articles.description: UC Santa Barbara physicists have engineered entangled spin systems in diamond that surpass classical sensing limits through quantum squeezing. Their breakthrough enables next-generation quantum sensors that are powerful, compact, and ready for real-world use.

articles.title: This 14th century story fooled the world about the Black Death
articles.description: Historians have traced myths about the Black Death’s rapid journey across Asia to one 14th-century poem by Ibn al-Wardi. articles.title: AI revives lost 3,000-year-old Babylonian hymn
articles.description: Researchers have rediscovered a long-lost Babylonian hymn from 1000 BCE, using artificial intelligence to piece together fragments scattered across the world. articles.description: New simulations suggest magnetic fields hold the key to forming black holes that defy known mass limits. articles.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
articles.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.description: Conservative MP Matt Jeneroux said Thursday he is resigning from the House of Commons, becoming the second Conservative to leave the caucus this week.
